member.name: M:System.Web.DomainServices.LinqToEntities.LinqToEntitiesDomainService`1.ProcessConcurrencyErrors(System.Web.DomainServices.ChangeSet,System.Data.OptimisticConcurrencyException)
member.summary: For the specified concurrency exception, inspect the concurrency errors and update the changeset operations with the error info

Reestablish EntityReferences for the specified entity by constructing new EntityReferences for each association member and setting it with an EntityKey TODO : Is there a better way to do this? Are there EF APIs I should be using?
member.param: Map of entity references that have been temporarily nulled out to work around EF Add/Attach API issues. TODO : remove this param when the workaround is no longer needed.

member.name: M:System.Web.DomainServices.LinqToEntities.LinqToEntitiesTypeDescriptionContext.GetAssociationInfo(System.Data.Metadata.Edm.NavigationProperty)
member.summary: Returns the association information for the specified navigation property by querying EF metadata. This method uses the FK constraint name of the navigation property to query the metadata workspace for the corresponding AssociationType. It then pulls out the information it needs to create our AssociationInfo.
member.remarks: To debug issues with this code, start by examining the actual ssdl/msl/csdl xml by reading it from the embedded resource or external mapping files. From that, you can see the structure we're working with here.
member.param: The navigation property to return association information for
member.returns: The association info

member.name: M:System.Web.DomainServices.LinqToEntities.LinqToEntitiesTypeDescriptionContext.CreateAssociationAttribute(System.Data.Metadata.Edm.NavigationProperty)
member.summary: Creates an [Association] attribute for the specified navigation property
member.param: The navigation property that corresponds to the association (it identifies the end points)
member.returns: A new AssociationAttribute that describes the given navigation property association

member.name: M:System.Web.DomainServices.LinqToEntities.LinqToEntitiesTypeDescriptionContext.NormalizeMetadataName(System.String)
member.summary: Names in the EF metadata are normalized by the metadata APIs at various levels, meaning if we wish to compare names (for example CSDL names and MSL names), we must normalize them prior by replacing invalid characters with an underscore.
member.returns: The unique association name.

member.name: M:System.Web.DomainServices.LinqToEntities.LinqToEntitiesTypeDescriptionContext.CreateMetadataWorkspace
member.summary: Creates the MetadataWorkspace to use to acquire metadata about the domain service. We are creating the metadata workspace manually in this way since our custom type descriptors need to query the SSpace DataSpace, meaning we need to load all the metadata not normally loaded.
member.returns: A new MetadataWorkspace

member.name: M:System.Web.DomainServices.LinqToEntities.LinqToEntitiesTypeDescriptionContext.FindMetadataFiles
member.summary: Locates and returns all the metadata files associated with the ObjectContext. These files might be embedded -- this helper method exists merely to locate them if they are not embedded. If an empty collection is returned, it probably means the metadata was embedded.
member.returns: The absolute paths to the metadata files if present

member.name: M:System.Web.DomainServices.LinqToEntities.LinqToEntitiesTypeDescriptionContext.GetAssociationName(System.Data.Metadata.Edm.NavigationProperty,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a unique association name for the specified navigation property.
member.param: The foreign key role name for the property's association
member.returns: A unique association name for the specified navigation property.

member.name: P:System.Web.DomainServices.LinqToEntities.LinqToEntitiesTypeDescriptionContext.MetadataWorkspace
member.summary: Gets the MetadataWorkspace for the ObjectContext

member.name: M:System.Web.DomainServices.LinqToEntities.LinqToEntitiesTypeDescriptor.CreateAssociationProperties(System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection)
member.summary: Creates all "synthesized" properties necessary for the [Association] attributes
member.remarks: Since EF includes all FK members of EntitiyReferences in its optimistic concurrency update checks, we have to expand all these members.
member.returns: A collection of new synthesized properties that must be added to the list of known properties

The list of new property descriptors to which to add the new one
